showcase_linear_regression.name: Predict Numeric Fields
showcase_linear_regression.description: Predict the value of a numeric field using a weighted combination of the values of other fields in that event. A common use of these predictions is to identify anomalies: predictions that differ significantly from the actual value may be considered anomalous.

showcase_linear_regression_it.name: Predict Numeric Fields
showcase_linear_regression_it.description: Predict the value of a numeric field using a weighted combination of the values of other fields in that event. A common use of these predictions is to identify anomalies: predictions that differ significantly from the actual value may be considered anomalous. As in the example below, an IT administrator could estimate server power consumption given metrics like CPU utilization and memory transactions.

showcase_linear_regression_sec.name: Predict Numeric Fields
showcase_linear_regression_sec.description: Predict the value of a numeric field using a weighted combination of the values of other fields in that event. A common use of these predictions is to identify anomalies: predictions that differ significantly from the actual value may be considered anomalous. As in the example below, a security analyst could predict the frequency of VPN usage based on the use of other apps and detect unusual activity.

showcase_linear_regression_biz.name: Predict Numeric Fields
showcase_linear_regression_biz.description: Predict the value of a numeric field using a weighted combination of the values of other fields in that event. A common use of these predictions is to identify anomalies: predictions that differ significantly from the actual value may be considered anomalous. As in the example below, a real estate analyst in Boston could predict the selling price of a house based on known factors like the number of rooms and neighborhood crime rate.

showcase_linear_regression_iot.name: Predict Numeric Fields
showcase_linear_regression_iot.description: Predict the value of a numeric field using a weighted combination of the values of other fields in that event. A common use of these predictions is to identify anomalies: predictions that differ significantly from the actual value may be considered anomalous. As in the example below, an analyst at a combined cycle power plant could estimate the plant's energy output from other (possibly easier to measure) metrics like ambient temperature and humidity.

showcase_classification.name: Predict Categorical Fields
showcase_classification.description: Predict the value of a categorical field using the values of other fields in that event. A common use of these predictions is to identify anomalies: predictions that differ significantly from the actual value may be considered anomalous.

showcase_classification_it.name: Predict Categorical Fields
showcase_classification_it.description: Predict the value of a categorical field using the values of other fields in that event. A common use of these predictions is to identify anomalies: predictions that differ significantly from the actual value may be considered anomalous. As in the example below, an IT administrator could predict hard drive failures using SMART metrics.

showcase_classification_sec.name: Predict Categorical Fields
showcase_classification_sec.description: Predict the value of a categorical field using the values of other fields in that event. A common use of these predictions is to identify anomalies: predictions that differ significantly from the actual value may be considered anomalous. As in the example below, a security analyst could predict the presence of malware using firewall traffic.

showcase_classification_biz.name: Predict Categorical Fields
showcase_classification_biz.description: Predict the value of a categorical field using the values of other fields in that event. A common use of these predictions is to identify anomalies: predictions that differ significantly from the actual value may be considered anomalous. As in the example below, a business analyst could predict whether a customer is likely to churn based on factors like their customer service interactions and billing history.

showcase_classification_iot.name: Predict Categorical Fields
showcase_classification_iot.description: Predict the value of a categorical field using the values of other fields in that event. A common use of these predictions is to identify anomalies: predictions that differ significantly from the actual value may be considered anomalous. As in the example below, and IoT administrator could infer the make and model of a vehicle using onboard metrics like engine temperature and vehicle speed.

showcase_outlier_detection.name: Detect Numeric Outliers
showcase_outlier_detection.description: Find values that differ significantly from previous values.

examples.name: Server Response Time
examples.label: Detect Outliers in Server Response Time

examples.name: Employee Logins (prediction errors)
examples.label: Detect Outliers in Number of Logins (vs. Predicted Value)

examples.name: Power Plant Humidity
examples.label: Detect Outliers in Power Plant Humidity

showcase_outlier_detection_it.name: Detect Numeric Outliers
showcase_outlier_detection_it.description: Find values that differ significantly from previous values. As in the example below, an IT administrator could look for outliers in server response time to alert them to a potential problem, and then drill down to investigate.

examples.name: Server Response Time
examples.label: Detect Outliers in Server Response Time

showcase_outlier_detection_sec.name: Detect Numeric Outliers
showcase_outlier_detection_sec.description: Find values that differ significantly from previous values. As in the example below, a security analyst could look for significant deviation from the predicted number of employee logins. The outliers in this example are not indications of a security threat; our predictive model did not know about Thanksgiving.

examples.name: Employee Logins (prediction errors)
examples.label: Detect Outliers in Number of Logins (vs. Predicted Value)

showcase_outlier_detection_biz.name: Detect Numeric Outliers
showcase_outlier_detection_biz.description: Find values that differ significantly from previous values. As in the example below, a business analyst could examine supermarket transactions involving an unusually large quantity of items to understand what factors influence big spenders.

showcase_outlier_detection_iot.name: Detect Numeric Outliers
showcase_outlier_detection_iot.description: Find values that differ significantly from previous values. As in the example below, a combined cycle power plant administrator could detect when the humidity deviates significantly from its typical range.

examples.name: Power Plant Humidity
examples.label: Detect Outliers in Power Plant Humidity

showcase_categorical_outlier_detection.name: Detect Categorical Outliers
showcase_categorical_outlier_detection.description: Find events that contain unusual combinations of values.

examples.name: Diabetic Data
examples.label: Detect Outliers in Diabetes Patient Records

examples.name: Phone Usage
examples.label: Detect Outliers in Mobile Phone Activity

showcase_categorical_outlier_detection_i.name: Detect Categorical Outliers
showcase_categorical_outlier_detection_i.description: Find events that contain unusual combinations of values. As in the example below, an IT administrator could look for unusual conditions related to hard drive failure, such as the reported drive capacity.

showcase_categorical_outlier_detection_s.name: Detect Categorical Outliers
showcase_categorical_outlier_detection_s.description: Find events that contain unusual combinations of values. As in the example below, a security analyst for a bitcoin exchange could look for unusual combinations of users and transaction amounts.

showcase_categorical_outlier_detection_b.name: Detect Categorical Outliers
showcase_categorical_outlier_detection_b.description: Find events that contain unusual combinations of values. As in the example below, a business analyst for a supermarket could look for unusual purchases, such as big spending by a customer who is typically frugal.

showcase_categorical_outlier_detection_i.name: Detect Categorical Outliers
showcase_categorical_outlier_detection_i.description: Find events that contain unusual combinations of values. As in the example below, an IoT administrator could look for unusual mobile phone activity, in terms of the number of incoming, outgoing, and missed calls.

examples.name: Phone Usage
examples.label: Detect Outliers in Mobile Phone Activity

showcase_forecast.name: Forecast Time Series
showcase_forecast.description: Forecast future values given past values of a metric (numeric time series).

examples.name: Employee Logins
examples.label: Forecast the Number of Employee Logins

examples.name: Bluetooth Devices
examples.label: Forecast the Number of Bluetooth Devices

showcase_forecast_it.name: Forecast Time Series
showcase_forecast_it.description: Forecast future values given past values of a metric (numeric time series). As in the example below, an IT administrator could forecast internet traffic at different times of the week to inform dynamic resource provisioning.

showcase_forecast_sec.name: Forecast Time Series
showcase_forecast_sec.description: Forecast future values given past values of a metric (numeric time series). As in the example below, a security analyst could forecast the number of expected employee logins. That forecast correctly anticipates few logins over the weekend, but lacks the external context to explain the Thanksgiving lull.

examples.name: Employee Logins
examples.label: Forecast the Number of Employee Logins

showcase_forecast_biz.name: Forecast Time Series
showcase_forecast_biz.description: Forecast future values given past values of a metric (numeric time series). As in the example below, a business analyst for a souvenir shop (at a beach resort in Queensland, Australia) could forecast sales revenue, correctly forecasting the spikes that regularly happen in December and March.

showcase_forecast_iot.name: Forecast Time Series
showcase_forecast_iot.description: Forecast future values given past values of a metric (numeric time series). As in the example below, an IoT administrator could forecast the number of people who are likely to be at a particular location by using historical counts of the number of bluetooth devices detected over time.

examples.name: Bluetooth Devices
examples.label: Forecast the Number of Bluetooth Devices

showcase_clustering.name: Cluster Numeric Events
showcase_clustering.description: Partition events with multiple numeric fields into clusters.

examples.name: Disk
examples.label: Cluster Hard Drives by SMART Metrics

showcase_clustering_it.name: Cluster Numeric Events
showcase_clustering_it.description: Partition events with multiple numeric fields into clusters. As in the example below, an IT administrator could cluster hard drives based on the self-monitoring metrics they generate.

examples.name: Disk
examples.label: Cluster Hard Drives by SMART Metrics

showcase_clustering_sec.name: Cluster Numeric Events
showcase_clustering_sec.description: Partition events with multiple numeric fields into clusters. As in the example below, a security analyst could cluster the behavior of employees based on how frequently they use business applications like Webmail or the VPN.

showcase_clustering_biz.name: Cluster Numeric Events
showcase_clustering_biz.description: Partition events with multiple numeric fields into clusters. As in the example below, a business analyst interested in understanding a housing market could cluster neighborhoods based on properties like crime rate and median house value.

showcase_clustering_iot.name: Cluster Numeric Events
showcase_clustering_iot.description: Partition events with multiple numeric fields into clusters. As in the examples below, an IoT administrator could cluster vehicles driven on a racetrack by onboard metrics like engine temperature and G-forces, or they could cluster the operating regimes of a power plant based on ambient measurements like temperature and vacuum.
